jobtitle: Email Migration Time Estimate - Written Opinion Needed - ~30 Minutes of work
content: I am looking for someone who is located in either Canada or USA, who has extensive experience in email migration, positive feedback and an impressive resume, Firms are welcome to apply and will be considered. The task is quick and simple; I have a client whose email systems I manage, and am discontinuing my services with them. I need to make sure that i give them a reasonable amount of time to migrate their content to accounts which they manage themselves or through a different service provider. I am looking to use your opinion as a second opinion and it will need to come in the form of a signed letter, accompanied by your current Resume. The accounts that will need to be transfered: The Current Setup which will need to be transferred to a new account: Microsoft Emails: The client has 11 email accounts with the following statistics : User 1 2.105 GB User 2 18.97 GB User 3 28.67 GB User 4 57.87 GB User 5 489.4 MB User 6 49.28 GB User 7 2.357 GB User 8 2.978 GB USer 9 26.84 GB User 10 39.16 GB User 11 6.692 GB Total Less than 240GB They would need to be ported to a new provider, The port process would need to be with user based rights (one user one password), as no administrative or elevated privileges will be available. Zoho Mail 8 Users. Total size under 13GB I am looking for a reasonable time estimate to transfer these accounts to a new account, the new account can be hosted with the same providers or new ones, but it should be assumed that regardless of who hosts the new accounts, it would be a sufficiently efficient transfer, with the receiving client capable of importing account data from current providers efficiently. It should be assumed that contact and calendar information will also be transferred. For the time estimate you should allot some time to setup distribution lists and forwarders. You should assume that each account has up to 10 aliases, up to 50 total distribution lists, and some accounts have global forwarding settings for inbound mail (particularly so for Zoho accounts) I am looking for a reasonable time frame assuming that reasonable urgency is given to the task, and necessary resources are immediately allocated to this task. With you application please include: A blurb about your experience Confirm that you/ with your team if applicable would be able to implement the above and deal with reasonable issues that may arise as course of normal transition Your location A rough time estimate you would expect this to take, (please assume that the client might choose to hire you for said move, and hold you to your time estimate) Cost to do this if you were to be hired to do this task less

jobtitle: Need data scientist with R proficiency to help build out an econometric simulation
content: For this project, we are looking to take an existing dataset + model design and build a machine learning simulation that projects changes to housing demand for various US zip codes on a year-by-year basis. This simple model will first predict housing demand (expressed as Housing Price Index value) for the following year based on economic/demographic attributes of a given zip code. Then, those demographics will be updated based on growth assumptions, and then HPI calculated again for the following year, and so on. Seeking a developer proficient in the R language as well as comfortable with core concepts of Machine Learning/statistical inference less

jobtitle: Need a scoring algorithm to rank products
content: Looking for someone with a math and data science background to create a scoring algorithm to assign a score out of 100 to products. There are about 10 different dimensions on which the product score would be based, and for each of these dimensions there are a few possible options. So what we'd like to do is assign a point value or weight to each option, and then create a scoring formula that will combine them all and output a score out of 100. For example: Product Feature A: -Good = 1 point -Better = 2 points -Best 2.5 points Product Feature B -Good = 0 points -Better = 1 point -Best = 3 points etc. We will provide a detailed list of the different dimensions and details on how we'd like to value them. Also note that the scores should be bell-curved to be mostly distributed in the 65 to 95 range. So the formula needs to ensure that scores never exceed 99, and generally should not be below 50-60. Please include any similar projects you've worked on that you think would be relevant, what your general approach would be, and any questions you have! less

jobtitle: Academic Citation Analysis (Medical) using VOSViewer and CitNetExplorer
content: We focus on the technology of Photobiomodulation (Infrared, Near Infrared and Low Level Laser Therapy). This technology has various applications in fields like Alzheimer's disease Cognitive performance Diabetic foot ulcer Exercise performance Oral mucositis Traumatic brain injury General Anti-Inflammation Wound Healing So we need to create subsets of journal articles through sophisticated Bolean Searches in e.g. Pubmed (and/or other simliar SciLit databases) for each of the application fields in connection with Photobiomodulation. Then, we shall extract sub-databases for each of the application fields that enable us to process them for cross-citation analysis with leading free visulization/analysis tools like VOS Viewer or CitNetExplorer. You might probably need to create importable JSON Files from Journal Databases like Pubmed or others. The End goal is to visualize who are the most influential and cited authors in a certain sub-field of Photobiomodulation applications. less

jobtitle: Website/App developer required to build a website from our designs. (Wordpress/frontend/backend)
content: Brief We are creating a website for user populated sports leagues (similar to fantasy football). The website will allow users to sign up and create their own interactive sporting league that will allow them and all their friends who join the league to input their statistics when they complete a round regarldess of where in the world they are. Each player can add their own scores and stats and then complete with others around the world in their league. Further details: The structure: Pages 1. Sign in/Sign up (this will be the homepage, so it's very simple) 2. Profile page (profile info, join and create a league). You will also be able to see all the leagues you are in. As you could be in multiple leagues. 3. League page. (something like this - http://alchemists-wp.dan-fisher.com/soccer/team/alchemists/) 4. Billing & payment page. 5. Page about player. What should be included on the league page? - A league table - Past Winners - Although this will be blank to begin with - Various Stats - any that we could include . E.g. player average score, best round, worst round. - Player Updates/Log - as someone enters a score it says "John Deer has just scored 36 points at..." (this on the right-hand side of the example page and I assume is built into the plugin) As we allow people to enter more stats we can increase the stats that are shown but to begin with I think that's all that's needed. Users must be able to easily add their scores and the leagues automatically updates. Personalisation of the league - Option to specify how many rounds for that league. This can be a fixed number of rounds each, or it can be time-based until a certain date where the best 10 scores are counted etc. Inclusion of Major Events - not essential but if we could do this would be great. The league organise can set certain dates as a ‘major’. One round you get an extra point for these rounds... adds a bit of pressure. Also if they have actual in person competitions - like a big tournament, I would like them to able to add the winner to the stats. It would also be good to be able to arrange these in person tournaments via the page. less
tags: Website, WordPress, Web Apps, Wordpress Website

jobtitle: Need a developer for creating a simple console SIP softphone (Linux, Windows). No GUI / control.
content: Need to develop a console SIP softphone running in the background (Linux and Windows). It is a good idea to use open source libraries such as PJSIP 1) SIP softphone connects to the Cloud server API (HTTPS) to get the registration settings: SIP login/pass, SIP server address/port/protocol. The cloud server will be developed by another team 2) SIP softphone is registered on the SIP server with the login/pass provided from the cloud server 3) SIP softphone receives task data from a cloud server (using Cloud server API). The task contains information about how often and to which number to make a call 4) SIP softphone makes calls according to the received task, send/receive RTP (softphone can play some test audio file) and collects all possible statistics about the call: call date and time, calling and called numbers, duration, and RTP stats: jitter, packet loss and calculate MOS. All collected statistics posts to the Cloud server 5) SIP softphone should be able to answer an incoming call. This need for the scenario when both SIP softphone clients registered on the same PBX Server and able to call each other Cloud Server will be developed by another team. This will be a VoIP monitoring system to collect and show information about the quality of the calls thru some PBX servers. less
tags: Standalone Application, Linux, SIP, VOIP Software

jobtitle: Automated App Analysis: Python Dev keyword searchable tool to automatically collect and analyze apps
content: I want to hire a Python and/or Javascript Developer to create an online research tool to automatically pull information on the most popular apps on any chosen topic. For example, if I am interested in determining the 25 most popular “language learning games” or “dance education” apps or “chemistry games” and being able to see trends about these apps -- I would be able to use the tool to do a keyphrase search using the tool and it would generate lots of meaningful and interesting data about these apps. The tool would use Google Play, App Store and/or App Annie data results to determine the most popular apps, generate this sample as a list, and collect various data automatically about these apps or games. Data includes information that can be automatically collected (e.g. target age, tags, app description, cost, and anything else that can be gathered) and also manually determined tags. It will then output it into a Google Sheet (spreadsheet) and run various analyses on them, and finally present them in a user friendly way (e.g. dashboard, pie charts, etc.). I want to be able to determine various trends about the most popular apps for research purposes. less

jobtitle: Google Sheets Script - Toggle Switch Show / Hide Columns and Rows
content: We are trying to develop a Google sheet to manage the schedule of 30 + people. We will manually update the cells for each person by time block. -We would like the ability to add a toggle to only show certain names or blocks of time. For example, if we wanted to only look at Alanna, Caroline and Tony for the 6:00, 7:00 and 8:00 time blocks and hide all the other cells. But, we want a simple check box that would hide the other cells we don't want to see (other names or time blocks). So we would only keep a check mark next to the times and names we want visible. -The employee names on the top row of the sheet will be edited (names added and names removed) on a monthly basis, so the script would need to account for that. -The scheduled appointments will change on a weekly basis - recurring appointments added or removed. See attached sample sheet. Names are at the top and if you scroll all the way to the right, there are sample fields that show as the control panel. If this is something you are able to do, please let me know as well as the amount of time it would take to create the script once we have the final sheet. Link to Sample Sheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1C-brYuJ2vkyJ0ontMBVhJTdl56KR__7RF6Yng8oGLjY/edit?usp=sharing Thank you! less
